cont.entity_a: Comfortable with many options, including media controls and programmable buttons.
cont.entity_b: Very good quality with easy-to-push buttons and a nice scroll wheel.

cont.entity_a: Compatible with Mac and works well with Logitech's SetPoint software.
Requires a USB receiver, which is long and takes up a USB port.
cont.entity_b: Receiver design is excellent for portability.

cont.entity_a: Performance is fantastic, with a long battery life on rechargeable batteries.
cont.entity_b: Very precise and works well for non-gaming purposes.

cont.entity_a: Occasionally confused on wooden patterned surfaces, but works with a piece of paper as a mouse pad.
cont.entity_b: Laser sensor works on multiple surfaces without problems.

cont.entity_a: Does not support all media programs, particularly Dell Media Experience.
cont.entity_b: Microsoft mice are more programmable than Logitech.

cont.entity_a: Durable, with some users experiencing over 5 years of use.
cont.entity_b: Some units experience problems with button durability and signal loss.

cont.entity_a: Transmission range decreases with unit age. The mouse has a good range for media operations (<30 ft) but less for mouse operations (<10 ft).
The mouse does not run on 2.4GHz.
Ergonomic design is generally comfortable, though some find it large and heavy. Design is symmetrical, suitable for right-handed users.
cont.entity_b: Ambidextrous design is not comfortable for long use. Design is not ergonomic, leading to discomfort with extended use.

cont.entity_a: Programmable buttons are not fully customizable.
The mouse is not ideal for left-handed users.
cont.entity_b: Some users find the mouse too small for comfortable use.

cont.entity_a: Some users experience issues with the cursor jumping or erratic behavior, which may require exchanging the mouse.
cont.entity_b: Wireless connection issues and erratic cursor movement reported.

cont.entity_a: Plastic around the lower side is less comfortable than newer models with cushion.
LED lights and media buttons work well with Windows Media and iTunes.
Considered a good value, especially for those who use media functions.
User-replaceable batteries are a preferred feature.
cont.entity_b: Consumes batteries quickly, with issues of sticky scroll wheel and unresponsive clicks over time.

cont.entity_a: Some users report issues with buttons requiring hard presses.
cont.entity_b: Some users find the buttons too hard to click.
Compact and fits well in the palm as a laptop mouse.
Magnifier feature is a unique selling point but not useful for everyone.
